alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 05 at 6:30AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING IMMEDIATE BROADCAST REQUESTED 07:00 AM PST Thu Jan 05 2023 The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: NWS Reno NV - CA-073 (Eastern Sierra in Mono County) * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area will remain HIGH at all elevations today.. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virginia Lakes to the north to Rock Creek to the south. * WHEN...In effect from Thu 07:00 AM PST to Fri 07:00 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow combined with extreme winds will likely create widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avalanches may run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
